a.g: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
And who brings out the pasture
We will make you recite, [O Muhammad], and you will not forget,
Except what Allah should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
And We will ease you toward ease.
So remind, if the reminder should benefit;
He who fears [Allah] will be reminded.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Fear and Hope
Indeed, God the Exalted has made it specific to those who fear [al-khÄ'ifÄ«n], for He said: "He who fears [yakhshÄ] will be reminded."

a.g: But the wretched one will avoid it -
[He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,
He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself
And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.
But you prefer the worldly life,
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Status and Ostentation
Indeed, the sight [basar] of most of creation is weak, confined to the immediate [al-'ajilah], its light [nur] does not extend to witnessing the consequences [al-'awaqib]. And for that reason, the Most High has said: "Rather, you prefer the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya], while the Hereafter [al-akhirah] is better and more enduring."
ÙˆØ£Ø¨ØµØ§Ø± Ø£ÙƒØ«Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø®Ù„Ù‚ Ø¶Ø¹ÙŠÙØ© Ù…Ù‚ØµÙˆØ±Ø© Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ø¬Ù„Ø© Ù„Ø§ ÙŠÙ…ØªØ¯ Ù†ÙˆØ±Ù‡Ø§ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø´Ø§Ù‡Ø¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¹ÙˆØ§Ù‚Ø¨ØŒ ÙˆÙ„Ø°Ù„Ùƒ Ù‚Ø§Ù„ ØªØ¹Ø§Ù„Ù‰ "Ø¨Ù„ ØªØ¤Ø«Ø±ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙŠØ§Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¯Ù†ÙŠØ§ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¢Ø®Ø±Ø© Ø®ÙŠØ± ÙˆØ£Ø¨Ù‚Ù‰"
ğŸ“– Vol 3: Disciplining the Soul
Indeed, preferring the life of this lower world [al-hayat al-dunya] is a dominant trait [tabi'] in man, and for this reason Allah, the Exalted, said: "Rather, you prefer the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya]." Then He clarified that this evil is ancient in the innate dispositions [al-taba'i'] and that this is mentioned in the previous scriptures, so He said: "Indeed, this is in the former scriptures, the scriptures of Abraham and Moses." This, then, is the method [minhaj] for disciplining the seeker [al-murid] and nurturing him in gradual progression to the meeting with Allah, the Exalted.

a.g: While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Self-Delusion
Indeed, as for belief [tasdiq] by mere faith [iman], it is that one believes Allah, the Exalted, in His saying, "And the Hereafter [al-akhira] is better and more lasting." And indeed, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, informed groups of the disbelievers of that, and they followed him and believed him and had faith in him, and they did not demand from him proof [burhan]. And this is the faith [iman] of the common people, and it delivers from delusion [ghurur]. And this is placed in the position of the child believing his father that attending the school is better than attending the playground, even though he does not know the aspect of its being better.

a.g: Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,
The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
